CatDescriptText: Bruno Buccina, 1605 Fifth Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "In the coming November elections, do you think voters should elect another Democratic Governor or change to a Republican?" answer reads: "As long as they don't get anybody in there who doesn't add more taxes, it will be all right with me. In other words, it doesn't matter who is in there as long as they are for the working man and will cut down the taxes.  As far as Republican or Democrat, I don't care who is elected as long as he is a good honest man."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bruno Buccina wearing work clothes posed with crossed arms in front of Bruno's service station, East Liberty
